text: - Hi, my name is Pat Gelsinger.
I'm the CEO of Intel,

and I've had a long and
wonderful history with AWS,

first in my EMC role,
then a CEO of VMware,
and now as the CEO of Intel,
a great partnership over many years.

I recall 15 years ago
when I first saw the Cloud
and S3 and EC2 emerging.
And my first reaction was, huh, right?

Why do I run it in the cloud
versus in the data center?
And all of a sudden the light bulb went on
and I said, this will change the industry.
This will change how people use computing.
And wow, that's certainly been the case
over the last 15 years.

Intel and AWS EC2 had an
incredible journey together,
where AWS is always saying,

how can we do a bigger module,
a bigger node instance type?

So be use in particular have
been areas that Intel and AWS
have been able to innovate together
in exciting, powerful ways.
And more recently, as we've talked about
our Intel Foundry Services

and AWS is one of our
first customers for those.

So we're quite excited
that this partnership
will keep nudging both of us along
to do greater and greater things.

Well, the first time I saw some
of the discussions around AI
and SageMaker, it was sort of like, wow,
making AI truly accessible for developers
in a very easy to use and powrful way.

And of course, how we could
enhance silicon underneath that

to make it faster, to
make it more programmable,
to be able to solve some of the data type
and data size problems associated with AI

and all of those uniquely
being made available with AWS
and Intel working together.

Cloud is becoming this
ubiquitous infrastructure.
But all of a sudden this,
we start to see 5G and edge computing.

It's how does the cloud
go from being a place,
which it largely is today,

but a computing model
that truly is available

wherever the customers
will want to use it.
I believe this next phase of cloud

isn't just about how we
make it bigger and faster,

but it's how we make it truly
geographically disperse,
where cloud goes from being a place

to truly a computing
model accessible tool.
